alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 25 at 4:11PM AKDT until October 26 at 5:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 5 inches. Northeast wind 15 to 25 mph along the Inlet with areas of blowing snow. Highest snow amounts will be from Soldotna north to Nikiski. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...From 8 AM this morning to 5 AM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Visibility reduced to one half mile or less at times in snow and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Warming temperatures for communities along Kachemak Bay, have caused snow to transition to rain this afternoon. Snow will continue to fall from Soldotna north to Nikiski as temperatures will remain below freezing. Precipitation may also mix with or change to rain as far north as Clam Gulch this evening. The heaviest snow will fall near Cook Inlet, including the Sterling Highway corridor through about 8pm.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
